Retirement Calculator

A generic retirement calculator to help you figure out how much you'll have when you retire.

How it works

This calculator is only meant to serve as a ballpark estimate and is by no means 100% accurate because we have to make simplified assumptions for certain things.

The living costs are calculated using the value for contributions towards saving: living costs = salary * (100% - contributions). From there, for each year the salary is increased by the specified factor and the living costs by inflation rate.

The annual savings are calculated by subtracting the living costs from the salary, they are then added to the total savings. We multiply each years total by the annual rate of return. To be more specific, the total savings you have access to for any given year is equal to (previous year's total savings) * rate of return + current years savings. This is similar to how a savings account usually works and to simplify we also apply the same logic to investments. Note that this calculator also doesn't take into things like a mortgage, which would stop after a certain period. To account for that you could for example subtract the annual mortgage payments from your salary instead.

Once the living costs overtake the income, we start using up our savings. For that we use the tax to calculate how much we need to withdraw/sell in order to have an amount that is equal the deficit for that year. This is another simplification because in case of investments we might not always be able to sell exactly the amount we need.
